item.description: Update Hazardous Materials Investigation; INC#1162; 07:00PM; 333 Universal Hollywood Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3mH2SCA; #StudioCity; A thorough inspection and methodical evaluation of the hotel room in question by an LAFD Hazardous Materials team yielded an unspecified quantity of black tar heroin, within which was a barely discernable trace of fentanyl sensed only by comprehensive instrumental testing. No other person than the young adult male hotel room occupant required medical attention or complained of any illness. The man was taken to an area hospital in fair condition. No escalating or off-site hazard was identified. Contrary to public rumor, LAFD Hazmat experts did NOT discover any "white powder" or "powdered substance" within the hotel room. L.A. County Health Hazmat has taken control of the scene, and will coordinate any remediation necessary. Media Inquiries: LAPD North Hollywood Division (Incident 2763) and L.A. County Health Hazmat.; FS 86; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 E287 E86 EM11 JT4 JT6 RA76 RA86 SQ87 T87; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Hazardous Material Investigation; INC#1162; 04:21PM; 333 Universal Hollywood Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3mH2SCA; #StudioCity; PRELIM: Summoned to investigate an unresponsive person in a 9th floor hotel room, LAPD and LAFD discovered (handwritten?) warning sign(s) telling others not to enter that room due to the presence of a potentially hazardous substance. The immediate area on floor 9 was calmly isolated, and nearby persons sheltered in place as an LAFD Hazardous Materials team assisted first arriving LAFD responders who have safely gained access to and are now treating the one "viable" male patient with unspecified symptoms found within the room. No escalating or off-site hazard has been identified, and there are no other persons at scene requiring medical attention or experiencing illness. It is expected that the one male patient discovered within the room (unknown age / condition / affiliation / circumstances) will be taken to an area hospital. LAPD and County Health Hazmat will then take control of what appears to be a static scene. Media Inquiries: LAPD North Hollywood Division (Incident 2763) and L.A. County Health Haz Mat; FS 86; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 E287 E86 EM11 JT4 JT6 RA76 RA86 SQ87 T87; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Pedestrians Struck; INC#0442; 09:10AM; 647 S Alvarado St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xphMT9; #Westlake; Unknown type/size truck vs pedestrians. No entrapment. Nine patients total (6 taken by ambulance to an area hospital, 3 have declined further care). One adult was seriously injured, the others have minor injuries. No details on ages / genders / affiliation / circumstances. Media Inquiries: LAPD Central Traffic Division (Incident #1145); FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 E11 E211 EM1 EM11 EM13 RA10 RA17 RA209 RA26 RA29 RA809 T11; CH4; 13; Brian Humphrey

Pedestrians Struck; INC#0442; 08:36AM; 647 S Alvarado St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xphMT9; #Westlake; PRELIM: Unknown type/size truck vs pedestrians. No entrapment. Currently five patients (3 adults / 2 children). All but one adult have minor injuries.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 E11 E211 EM1 EM11 EM13 RA10 RA209 RA26 RA29 RA809 T11; CH4; 13; Brian Humphrey

Pedestrian Fatality; INC#1802; 09:56PM; SB 5 Fwy south of 170 Fwy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3va6L8D; #Arleta; PRELIM: One person (unknown age / gender / affiliation / circumstances) deceased in traffic lanes after reportedly being struck by one or more vehicles. No other injuries reported. Firefighters are assisting the California Highway Patrol, Caltrans and Coroner's Office with the discreet and dignified removal of remains. One or more freeway lanes will remain closed until emergency operations and the CHP investigation is complete, unknown duration. Expect congestion and delay. Please avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are available. Monitor traffic reports on news radio. Media Inquiries: CHP Altadena Log #3378 and Coroner.; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; E289 E7 RA7 T89; CH8; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Fire; INC#1538; 07:12PM; 4520 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NJFbW6; #EastHollywood; First arriving 30 LAFD Firefighters took just 24 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish a well-involved delivery truck trailer (unknown contents) parked at a loading dock to the rear of a grocery store that was open for business. Firefighters calmly evacuated all (unspecified number) patrons and workers from the two-story supermarket of concrete tilt-up construction. Though some smoke entered the rear of the store, there was no fire extension. No injuries have been reported. The fire's cause is under investigation.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM22 E13 E20 E203 E215 E227 E229 E235 E27 E29 E3 E35 E56 EM11 HR3 RA6 RA835 T15 T27 T29 T3 T35 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1538; 06:48PM; 4520 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NJFbW6; #EastHollywood; PRELIM: Heavy fire within one delivery truck trailer at a loading dock, threatening the rear of a grocery store of concrete tilt-up construction, currently open for business, and now being calmly evacuated.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM22 E13 E20 E203 E215 E227 E229 E235 E27 E29 E3 E35 E56 EM11 HR3 RA6 RA835 T15 T27 T29 T3 T35 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Brush Fire; INC#0973; 02:30PM; 11600 W Kagel Canyon St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MHWJRp; #LakeViewTerrace; Assisted by precise and timely water drops from a pair of LAFD helicopters, 50 LAFD ground responders, with swift Automatic Aid from Los Angeles County Fire Department and Angeles National Forest firefighters, held the fire to approximately two (2) acres of light grass and medium brush adjacent to the Foothill (I-210) Freeway. No injury. No structure damage. Minor lane closure on nearby surface streets only. No lane closure on freeway. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 BP74 E24 E274 E275 E290 E298 E7 E77 E90 E91 E98 EM10 H2 H4 H5 HA2 HA4 HA5 RA74 T74 T75 T90 T98 WT77 + LACoFD + ANF; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#0973; 01:51PM; 11600 W Kagel Canyon St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MHWJRp; #LakeViewTerrace; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response with the Los Angeles County Fire Department to now one-half (0.5) acre vegetation burning between homes and the Foothill (I-210) Freeway; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 BP74 E24 E274 E275 E290 E298 E7 E77 E90 E91 E98 EM10 H2 H4 H5 HA2 HA4 HA5 RA74 T74 T75 T90 T98 WT77; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - #FedoraFire Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/10/2022 INC#0640

item.description: Knockdown - #FedoraFire Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0640; 11:32AM; 936 S Fedora St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3aVjX9p; #Koreatown; 110 LAFD Firefighters took just 52 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish heavy fire on both floors and the attic of a vacant 2,420 square-foot, two-story craftsman-style home, built in 1915. The fire was prevented from damaging adjacent apartment buildings. Two firefighters briefly sought on-site medical attention for minor injuries. No hospital care was required, and they will remain active in emergency operations at the scene. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM22 E13 E203 E209 E211 E215 E220 E226 E229 E26 E260 E29 E3 E52 E89 EA1 EM1 EM18 HU59 RA29 RA52 RA803 RA829 SQ21 T11 T15 T20 T29 T3 T60 T9 UR3; CH9; 1 2 16; Brian Humphrey
